playn.core

Interface CanvasImage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Image

    public interface CanvasImage
extends Image
    An image that provides a Canvas that allows you to draw directly into the image.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface playn.core.Image

        Image.BitmapTransformer, Image.Region

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Canvas canvas()
      Returns this image's canvas.
      void setRgb(int startX, int startY, int width, int height, int[] rgbArray, int offset, int scanSize)
      Sets pixel data for a rectangular area of this image.
      Image snapshot()
      Returns a snapshot of this canvas image that is no longer mutable.

      • Methods inherited from interface playn.core.Image

        addCallback, clearTexture, ensureTexture, getRgb, height, isReady, repeatX, repeatY, scale, setMipmapped, setRepeat, subImage, toPattern, transform, width

    • Method Detail

      • canvas

        Canvas canvas()
        Returns this image's canvas.

      • snapshot

        Image snapshot()
        Returns a snapshot of this canvas image that is no longer mutable. Subsequent changes to this canvas will not be reflected in the returned image. If you are going to render a canvas image into another canvas image a lot, using a snapshot can improve performance.

      • setRgb

        void setRgb(int startX,
          int startY,
          int width,
          int height,
          int[] rgbArray,
          int offset,
          int scanSize)
        Sets pixel data for a rectangular area of this image. This method may perform poorly, in particular on HTML and Flash platforms - avoid using this if possible. The pixel format is (alpha << 24 | red << 16 | green << 8 | blue), where alpha, red, green and blue are the corresponding channel values, ranging from 0 to 255 inclusive. Currently not implemented for iOS.
        Parameters:
        startX - x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
        startY - y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the area.
        width - width of the area.
        height - height of the area.
        rgbArray - will be filled with the pixel data from the area
        offset - fill start offset in rgbArray.
        scanSize - number of pixels in a row in rgbArray.
